banners.title: Empower your finance. Grow with clarity.
banners.subtitle:
As a CA-led consulting firm, VGC helps MSMEs navigate tax, finance, and compliance with confidence.
We bring expert, data-backed advice and disciplined processes for a stronger financial foundation.
Our structured workflows and timely responses ensure a seamless, professional experience.

banners.title: On-time. Audit-ready. Outcome-driven.
banners.subtitle:
As your finance partner, we turn complex filings and numbers into clear, usable insights.
We deliver compliant returns, reliable MIS, and calm handling of notices and assessments.
Our proactive updates and SLAs keep everything moving—without last-minute stress.

banners.title: Finance made simpler for founders.
banners.subtitle:
As a focused MSME advisory, we align tax, GST, and accounts to your growth goals.
We set up clean documentation, smart reconciliations, and decision-ready reporting.
Our client-first approach and quick turnarounds make working with us effortless.

banners.title: GST done right, every month.
banners.subtitle:
As GST specialists, we help you file accurately and protect ITC while you scale.
We deliver data-backed 2B-to-books reconciliation and compliant R1/3B/Annual returns.
Our monthly calendar and swift responses keep GST stress-free and on schedule.

banners.title: No visibility = no control.
banners.subtitle:
As your VCFO partner, we turn numbers into decisions you can act on.
We close P&L, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow within clear timelines—every month.
Our variance commentary and board-ready MIS bring discipline and speed.

banners.title: Start right. Stay compliant.
banners.subtitle:
As incorporation experts, we set up Pvt Ltd, LLP, OPC, and NGOs with clean checklists.
We guide you from name approval to bank-ready kit, GST, and ROC filings.
Our structured process and prompt coordination make setup smooth and professional.

services.title: Registration Services
services.short_description: We structure your entity, file documents correctly the first time, and obtain all the registrations your business needs to operate without friction.
services.long_description:
Our Key Offerings

From new incorporations to sectoral licenses and conversions, our CA-led team manages name checks, documentation, e-sign/DSC, filings, approvals and post-incorporation tasks. You get a compliant start with zero follow-up hassle and a strong legal foundation.

Services

  • Private Limited Company (Pvt Ltd) Registration

  • Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) Registration

  • One Person Company (OPC) Registration

  • Partnership Firm Registration

  • Sole Proprietorship Registration (via MSME/Udyam + GST)

  • Section 8 Company (NGO) Registration

  • Producer Company Registration

  • Startup India Registration (DPIIT)

  • GST Registration (Goods & Services Tax)

  • PAN & TAN Application

  • Professional Tax Registration

  • Import Export Code (IEC) Registration

  • ESI Registration (Employee State Insurance)

  • PF Registration (Provident Fund)

  • TDS Return Filing Setup

  • Income Tax Return (ITR) Filing Setup

  • Digital Signature Certificate (DSC)

  • MSME / Udyam Registration

  • FSSAI License (for food businesses)

  • Shop & Establishment Act License

  • Labour License / Contract Labour Registration

  • GEM Portal Registration (for government tenders)

  • ISO Certification Support (via tie-ups)

  • Trade License (Municipal level)

  • RERA Registration (for builders/agents)

  • Niti Aayog NGO Darpan Registration

  • Trust, Society or NGO Registration

  • 80G & 12A Registration (for tax exemption for NGOs)

  • Trademark Registration (often in collaboration with legal professionals)

  • Foreign Company/Branch Office Setup (FEMA, RBI Approvals)

  • Startup Funding Documentation & Compliance

  • CMA Data & Project Report Preparation for Loans

DIR-3 KYC & DIN Compliance

services.title: Taxation and Liability Compliance Services
services.sub_heading: Complete direct & indirect tax compliance with notices and litigation support.
services.short_description: We plan, compute, file and defend—across Income-tax, TDS, GST, PF/ESI and corporate filings.
services.long_description:
Our Key Offerings

Our tax engine combines process discipline with expert review to deliver timely computations, reconciliations and statutory submissions with documented trails. From e-way bills and ITC to scrutiny and refunds, we manage end-to-end so you stay compliant and confident.

Services

  • Income Tax Return (ITR) Filing – for individuals, businesses, and companies

  • Tax Audit under Section 44AB

  • Advance Tax Computation & Payment

  • TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) Compliance

  • TDS Deduction & Deposit

  • TDS Return Filing (Form 24Q, 26Q, etc.)

  • TDS Certificates (Form 16, Form 16A)

  • Form 15CA/15CB Certification – for foreign remittances

  • Income Tax Notices & Scrutiny Handling

  • Input Tax Credit (ITC) Reconciliation

  • GST Audit & Certification

  • E-way Bill Generation & Support

  • GST Refund Filing

  • GST Notice Reply & Litigation Handling

  • Annual ROC Filing (AOC-4, MGT-7, etc.)

  • LLP Annual Return (Form 8 & 11)

  • Provident Fund (PF) Registration, Return Filing & Payment

Legal & Regulatory Compliance Reviews

services.title: Accounting and Bookkeeping
services.sub_heading: Reliable transaction capture to investor-grade financial statements.
services.short_description: We maintain day-to-day books, reconcile banks and ledgers, close months on time, and prepare financials your auditors and lenders will love.
services.long_description:
Our Key Offerings

Our bookkeeping framework standardises your chart of accounts, documentation and cut-offs. We reconcile cash/bank/suspense, track ledgers precisely and prepare financial statements aligned with statutory and management needs—so MIS, audits and decisions become faster and simpler.

Services

  • Transactional Bookkeeping

  • Bank & Cash Reconciliation

  • Ledger Maintenance

  • Financial Statements Preparation

  • Year-End Closing & Auditor Assistance

Payroll Accounting

services.title: Complete accounts and Finance
services.sub_heading: Process-driven finance operations across accounting, compliance and AR/AP.
services.short_description: We stitch accounting, compliance, payables and receivables into one controlled workflow with tools, SLAs and dashboards.
services.long_description:
Our Key Offerings

We design your finance operating model—workflows, maker-checker, document trails, automation and periodic controls—covering accounting, compliance, AP/AR and banking. The result is speed with reliability: faster closes, fewer follow-ups, and better vendor/customer experience.

Services

  • Process Accounting Automation

  • Compliances + Accounting & Booking

  • Account Payable & Receivable + Compliance

services.title: F&A Mastry
services.sub_heading: Insightful analysis, robust compliance, and stronger internal capability.
services.short_description: We turn data into dashboards and management views, tighten compliances, and build team/process capability to scale.
services.long_description:
Our Key Offerings

Beyond bookkeeping and filings, we focus on what helps founders steer: timely MIS, variance analysis, trend views, and cash/working-capital visibility—backed by compliance hygiene and capability building. We help your team adopt best-practice rhythms so performance compounds month after month.

Services

  • Analysis and Reporting

  • Compliances

  • Process and Team Capability

blogs.title: Why are CFO Services Important?
blogs.short_description: CFO refers to the Chief Financial Officer, a senior executive who is holistically responsible for the management of the financial undertakings of the company.
blogs.long_description:
Often, companies commit small blunders in their pursuit of wanting to handle everything, starting from planning to taking over the finance part. This blunder can vanish if the mastermind of the company considers CFO Services and if, in case, you want your hands on the best services that are away from your reach. Then worry not! A virtual CFO is there for your rescue. Now, when it comes to virtual CFO, you might think it is less effective than offline CFO Services; however, contrary to that belief. Whether virtual or remote, CFO Services will always remain CFO Services.

Who is a CFO?

CFO refers to the Chief Financial Officer, a senior executive who is holistically responsible for the management of the financial undertakings of the company. He/She is a topmost executive and is the financial controller, who takes it into his hands to solve everything relating to cash flow, financial planning, and taxation issues. Often considered to have the highest financial position and the third-highest position in the company, the CFO is vital in deciding the company's strategic initiatives.

Are the CEO and CFO similar?

No, the CEO and CFO are not similar, as CFOs are expected to work diligently with a company's other senior executives, including the CEO. Executives belonging to the CFO are referred to as the C-Suite of the company and represent themselves as the highest decision maker, thus marking all the boxes of other executives in the company. Although, the CFO is typically in a subordinate position to that of the CEO in the hierarchical structure of the corporate world. CFOs generally are the most efficient in terms of decision-making within the department, considering financial interactions in a particular firm.

Responsibilities of a CFO

➔ Controllership duties

Controllership duties hold the CFO responsible for presenting and reporting accurate and timely financial information based on the historical shreds of evidence presented by the company. All stakeholders in the company, including shareholders, analysts, creditors, employees, future investors, and other members of the management, depend on the accuracy and timeliness of this information. The information reported by the CFO must be confidently deemed to be accurate, as many decisions are based on it.

➔ Treasury Duties

The CFO is also responsible for the company's current financial condition; therefore, they must come to terms with how to invest the company's money, further taking into consideration the risk and liquidity associated with the company. Plus, the CFO oversees the company's capital structure, allowing them to determine the best mix of debt, equity, and internal financing. Resorting to address the issues surrounding the company's capital structure is one of the most important duties of a CFO and is considered vital.

➔ Economic forecasting

A CFO is responsible for a company's past ventures and its present financial situation, as they are regarded to be a key player in a company's future growth and its increased potential to achieve that. The officer must be able to identify and report what areas of a company are considered the most efficient and how the company can capitalise on this information.

Advantages of a CFO Services

● Increase in Efficiency

Getting a CFO ticks all the boxes you require to focus on the success of your organisation as they help you make better decisions, optimise processes, and save money. Enrolling a CFO will allow them to look at every aspect of the business, not leaving behind any nook and corner. Through this, CFOs enable you to see where things could be streamlined to help reduce costs or maximise profits, thus making your company grow efficiently and make your business more efficient.

● Business Growth

The role of a CFO is primarily to help you achieve your goals in the market, especially if you are one of those companies who trust their CFO with their eyes closed. Then congratulations! You are already on the right path of advancement, and this is your call to continue doing so. CFOs have all the ideas about your goals and how you wish to achieve them. This enables them to assess your growth starting from where you started and helps you pave the paths of success by guiding you towards strategies that allow you to scale, thus preventing the scope of unsustainable growth.

● Tax Compliance

Companies are expected to deal with large-scale tax regulations. As much as complying with them is necessary, the need to adhere to the rules and regulations is also important, lest a disruption occur due to the regular audits that take place under Government Audits. However, if a CFO is enrolled in your company, then fear not! The CFO ensures the task of properly making your firm understand the tax obligations and helps you maintain the same.

FAQ’s (Frequently Asked Questions)

  1. Decision-making is easy as I have a responsible team to give forward the best measures effectively. Why add up additional expenses by opening up space for a CFO?

We do not doubt your decision-making skills as we hold you highly concerned for single handedly bringing your company to such a large scale all these years. However, greater workloads require specially qualified people to look into it particularly because they will act as your helpful hand and provide the best measures to upgrade your company.

  1. What if a CFO makes a mistake in the financial report?

It is nearly impossible for a CFO to make calculation mistakes as they are well-known for their reputation as the company's C-suite, despite being subordinate to the CEOs. Still, if your CFO fails to make an accurate report of your company's financial accounting, consider checking your data or help your CFO as well. Humans are prone to mistakes, and our nature of dealing with them is the main answer.

blogs.title: The Importance of Diversification in Inve
blogs.short_description: Venenatis aliquet odio orci viverra quisque ultricies nec. Mollis dolor diam vitae est varius magna.
blogs.long_description:
Running a business is challenging enough without getting tangled in tax errors. Yet, for many MSMEs, tax-related mistakes can lead to penalties, missed savings, and unnecessary stress. Here are the five most common mistakes we see — and how you can steer clear of them.vgsvgdvsgvdgj

1. Missing Filing Deadlines

Late filings don't just result in fines; they can also damage your compliance record. Set reminders well in advance and work with a tax advisor to ensure timely submissions.

2. Poor Record-Keeping

Incomplete or disorganized records make tax preparation harder and increase the risk of errors. Adopt a consistent system for storing invoices, receipts, and financial statements.

3. Overlooking Eligible Deductions

Many MSMEs fail to claim deductions for expenses like office rent, utilities, and professional services. A knowledgeable accountant can identify these opportunities and reduce your taxable income.

4. Misclassifying Income or Expenses

Incorrect categorization can trigger audits. Always f

blogs.long_description:
Running a business is challenging enough without getting tangled in tax errors. Yet, for many MSMEs, tax-related mistakes can lead to penalties, missed savings, and unnecessary stress. Here are the five most common mistakes we see — and how you can steer clear of them.

1. Missing Filing Deadlines

Late filings don't just result in fines; they can also damage your compliance record. Set reminders well in advance and work with a tax advisor to ensure timely submissions.

2. Poor Record-Keeping

Incomplete or disorganized records make tax preparation harder and increase the risk of errors. Adopt a consistent system for storing invoices, receipts, and financial statements.

3. Overlooking Eligible Deductions

Many MSMEs fail to claim deductions for expenses like office rent, utilities, and professional services. A knowledgeable accountant can identify these opportunities and reduce your taxable income.

4. Misclassifying Income or Expenses

items.quote: Engaging with VGC Advisor changed the course of my financial life. They took the time to learn about my short- and long-term objectives, presenting a road map to financial achievement. Their openness and experience make them a reliable partner in my financial planning.
items.author: Manish Kumar | Partner, Space Electrical

data.left_text: Built on Trust. Measured by Outcomes.
data.right_subtext: •	Real stories from clients who’ve moved from chaos to clarity with VGC.

data.subtext: From GST and direct tax to audits and VCFO, we set up disciplined processes and on-time filings that management can trust.
data.main_heading: Turn compliance into clarity—and clarity into action

data.heading: About Us
data.left_description:
VGC Advisors is a CA-led financial consulting and accounting firm built on Trust. Satisfaction. Growth. Incorporated in 2017 in Noida, we grew out of the chartered accountancy practice Vipin Gupta & Co.—bringing that legacy of discipline into a broader, MSME-focused advisory. Today, from our Noida HQ with a Hapur branch, our cross-functional team (CAs, CS, lawyers, analysts) helps founders turn finance from a headache into a growth lever.
We partner with micro, small and medium enterprises to solve end-to-end finance: Registration Services, Taxation & Liability Compliance, Accounting & Bookkeeping, Complete Accounts & Finance, and F&A Mastry. Our approach is simple—understand your business, set up clean processes, communicate proactively, and deliver audit-ready filings and decision-ready MIS. The result: fewer surprises, faster decisions, and a stronger foundation to scale.

items.title: Powerhouse Expertise
items.description: A cross-functional team of CAs, CS, lawyers, and analysts combining technical mastery with real-world business insight—so advice works in practice, not just on paper.

items.title: Solutions Built for You
items.description: We learn your model, risks, and goals, then design tailored strategies across tax, GST, accounts, and finance that solve today’s issues and create tomorrow’s opportunities.

items.title: Everything Under One Roof
items.description: From registrations and filings to audits, MIS/VCFO, corporate finance, and RBI/FEMA, we deliver end-to-end execution—one partner, one process, zero last-minute stress.

items.title: Local Knowledge, Global Vision
items.description: Headquartered in Noida with a Hapur branch and clients across India/overseas, we navigate domestic rules and cross-border compliance seamlessly.

items.title: On-Time, SLA-Driven Delivery
items.description: Clear calendars, checklists, and owner assignments for every engagement—so filings, reconciliations, and MIS close on schedule.

items.title: Audit-Ready Documentation
items.description: Workpapers, reconciliations, and evidence folders organized the way auditors and bankers expect—reducing queries and closure time.

items.title: Transparent, Founder-Friendly Pricing
items.description: No surprises. Scope, timelines, and inclusions are spelled out up front; plans to fit early-stage and growth-stage MSMEs.

items.title: Secure & Confidential
items.description: Data security and access controls across files and tools; NDA on request; strict handling of sensitive financial information.

items.title: Tech-Enabled Workflows
items.description: Comfortable with Tally, Zoho, QuickBooks, Excel, and bank connectors; 2B-to-books GST reconciliation and MIS automation baked into our process.

items.title: Bank- & Board-Ready Reporting
items.description: Project reports, CMA data, QIRs, and MIS packs with ratios and variance commentary—built to win approvals and inform decisions.

data.heading: Why Choose VGC Advisors
data.subtext: CA-led, MSME-focused, and built on Trust. Satisfaction. Growth. Since 2017, we’ve turned complex tax & finance into clean compliance and decision-ready numbers—with disciplined processes, clear SLAs, and proactive communication.

data.right_description:
At VGC Advisors, the best outcomes happen when your vision meets our CA-led rigor. We listen first, map risks and opportunities, and design practical processes—so every step is precise, compliant, and aligned to your goals.
We turn complexity into clarity with data-backed advice, clean documentation, and on-time execution. From reconciliations and GST filings to MIS and audits, our structured SLAs and proactive updates build a foundation you can scale on—confidently and sustainably.

members.name: Ankit Garg
members.description: At VGC Advisors, the best results come from the perfect blend of your vision and our expertise. Your goals shape the journey; our strategic approach ensures every step is precise, compliant, and growth-focused. We combine deep financial insight with hands-on execution, transforming complex challenges into clear opportunities. Through disciplined saving, budgeting, compliance, and accounting, we help you build a strong foundation for lasting success — so your dreams aren’t just achieved, they’re sustained.

data.left_description:
From our base in Noida (India) with a footprint in Surrey (Canada), we help MSMEs operate confidently within India and across borders.
We handle the finance stack end-to-end—entity/branch setup, IEC/GEM/DPIIT registrations, GST & direct-tax compliance, disciplined bookkeeping, monthly MIS, and bank-ready reports—while our cross-border team manages FEMA/FDI approvals, ODI/LRS filings, 15CA/CB certifications, and documentation for fund movements.
Whether you’re expanding to a new state or a new country, our SLA-driven processes, audit-ready workpapers, and founder-friendly coordination keep timelines predictable and compliance clean. Global insight, local execution.

banners.title: End-to-End Finance, Tax & Compliance for MSMEs
banners.subtitle: From company/LLP registrations, GST & Income-tax, RBI/FEMA and statutory filings to daily accounting, MIS, AP/AR and CFO-style reporting—VGC delivers CA-led, reliable outcomes that keep you compliant and growth-ready.

data.title: A Personal Note from Our Co-Founders
data.description:
Growing VGC Advisors from a boutique CA practice into a full-stack finance partner has taught us something simple: MSMEs don’t just need filings — they need clarity, speed, and trust.
We built VGC on that promise: Trust. Satisfaction. Growth. From registrations and GST/Income-tax to disciplined bookkeeping, MIS/VCFO, and FEMA/FDI support, our work is designed to be on-time, audit-ready, and founder-friendly.
Our role is to turn complexity into calm – with clear checklists, SLAs, and communication that keeps you in control. Whether you’re formalising a new entity or scaling across borders, we’ll be in your corner with practical advice, clean documentation, and decision-ready numbers.

The information reported by the CFO must be confidently deemed to be accurate, as many decisions are based on it.

➔ Treasury Duties

The CFO is also responsible for the company's current financial condition; therefore, they must come to terms with how to invest the company's money, further taking into consideration the risk and liquidity associated with the company. Plus, the CFO oversees the company's capital structure, allowing them to determine the best mix of debt, equity, and internal financing. Resorting to address the issues surrounding the company's capital structure is one of the most important duties of a CFO and is considered vital.

➔ Economic forecasting

A CFO is responsible for a company's past ventures and its present financial situation, as they are regarded to be a key player in a company's future growth and its increased potential to achieve that. The officer must be able to identify and report what areas of a company are considered the most efficient and how the company can capitalise on this information.

Advantages of a CFO Services

● Increase in Efficiency

Getting a CFO ticks all the boxes you require to focus on the success of your organisation as they help you make better decisions, optimise processes, and save money. Enrolling a CFO will allow them to look at every aspect of the business, not leaving behind any nook and corner. Through this, CFOs enable you to see where things could be streamlined to help reduce costs or maximise profits, thus making your company grow efficiently and make your business more efficient.

● Business Growth

The role of a CFO is primarily to help you achieve your goals in the market, especially if you are one of those companies who trust their CFO with their eyes closed. Then congratulations! You are already on the right path of advancement, and this is your call to continue doing so. CFOs have all the ideas about your goals and how you wish to achieve them. This enables them to assess your growth starting from where you started and helps you pave the paths of success by guiding you towards strategies that allow you to scale, thus preventing the scope of unsustainable growth.

● Tax Compliance

Companies are expected to deal with large-scale tax regulations. As much as complying with them is necessary, the need to adhere to the rules and regulations is also important, lest a disruption occur due to the regular audits that take place under Government Audits. However, if a CFO is enrolled in your company, then fear not! The CFO ensures the task of properly making your firm understand the tax obligations and helps you maintain the same.

FAQ’s (Frequently Asked Questions)

  1. Decision-making is easy as I have a responsible team to give forward the best measures effectively. Why add up additional expenses by opening up space for a CFO?

We do not doubt your decision-making skills as we hold you highly concerned for single handedly bringing your company to such a large scale all these years. However, greater workloads require specially qualified people to look into it particularly because they will act as your helpful hand and provide the best measures to upgrade your company.

  1. What if a CFO makes a mistake in the financial report?

It is nearly impossible for a CFO to make calculation mistakes as they are well-known for their reputation as the company's C-suite, despite being subordinate to the CEOs. Still, if your CFO fails to make an accurate report of your company's financial accounting, consider checking your data or help your CFO as well. Humans are prone to mistakes, and our nature of dealing with them is the main answer.

blogs.long_description:
Running a business is challenging enough without getting tangled in tax errors. Yet, for many MSMEs, tax-related mistakes can lead to penalties, missed savings, and unnecessary stress. Here are the five most common mistakes we see — and how you can steer clear of them.vgsvgdvsgvdgj

1. Missing Filing Deadlines

Late filings don't just result in fines; they can also damage your compliance record. Set reminders well in advance and work with a tax advisor to ensure timely submissions.

2. Poor Record-Keeping

Incomplete or disorganized records make tax preparation harder and increase the risk of errors. Adopt a consistent system for storing invoices, receipts, and financial statements.

3. Overlooking Eligible Deductions

Many MSMEs fail to claim deductions for expenses like office rent, utilities, and professional services. A knowledgeable accountant can identify these opportunities and reduce your taxable income.

4. Misclassifying Income or Expenses

data.left_title: Build a Career in Strategic Finance — With Impact
data.left_description: Join VGC Advisors to help MSMEs and growing companies gain financial clarity, compliance, and momentum. Work with a CA-led team, solve real business problems, and grow your craft across registrations, tax, accounts, and CFO-style MIS. If you’re driven by ownership, speed, and measurable outcomes, you’ll thrive here.

left_section.title: Why Work With Us
left_section.description:
• At VGC Advisors Private Limited, we believe in the Win–Win–Win strategy:

  • Client Satisfaction above all else.

  • Team Empowerment for collective growth.

  • Owner's Success as our shared goal.

left_section.title: What we offer:
left_section.description:
• Impact-Driven Work: Help MSMEs achieve sustainable, profitable growth.

  • Strong Mentorship: Learn directly from Chartered Accountants, Business Analysts, and corporate finance experts.

  • Professional Growth Path: From Junior to Senior roles, Partner, and HOD.

  • Continuous Learning: Industry-leading training and exposure to complex finance, tax, and compliance projects.

left_section.title: Our Culture & Values
left_section.description:
• You will thrive here if you:

  • Take ownership and show high accountability.

  • Love solving problems and improving processes.

  • Value accuracy, compliance, and timely delivery.

left_section.title: This may not be for you if you:
left_section.description:
• Avoid client interaction.

  • Struggle with deadlines or long hours.

  • Dislike financial operations or managing people.

left_section.title: Non-Negotiables:
left_section.description:
• 100% Office Presence (No Remote).

  • 6-Day Work Week.

  • 9–10 hour workdays (flexible based on workload).

left_section.title: Life at VGG
left_section.description:
• We are a fast-growing consulting firm that thrives on collaboration, innovation, and results. Our work environment is:

  • Supportive & Collaborative: Open communication with management.

  • Growth-Oriented: Opportunities for skill upgrades, leadership roles, and ESOP-based wealth creation.

  • Engaging: Training sessions, team tours, celebrations, and professional networking.

right_section.title: Our Hiring Process
right_section.description:
• Application Review & Resume Screening

  • Basic Aptitude Test

  • Technical Test (Finance & Compliance)

  • Task Round (Role-Specific Case)

  • Personal Interview

  • Offer & Documentation

right_section.title: Benefits & Perks
right_section.description:
• Competitive salaries & bonuses.

  • ESOP opportunities for wealth creation.

  • Professional coaching & industry exposure.

  • Structured training resources.

  • Work directly with decision-makers.

  • Good comm
